page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: The text describes a rural area, studied by Junior School Children. It introduces the area and describes its origins to help strangers to understand its characteristics. The Church was studied in detail. Its earliest part is Saxon and it contains rare wall paintings and a superb 12th Century North Arcade. The "hill" of magnesium limestone supports botanical specimens of interest. The surrounding farms and local amenities are typical of a country area. The final comments by local poeple summarize the loyalty and affection felt by the community towards their enviroment in 1985.
